text: {{Infobox settlement | name = Amapá | native_name = | native_name_lang = pt | settlement_type = State | image_skyline = | image_alt = | image_caption = | image_flag = Bandeira do Amapá.svg | flag_link = Flag of Amapá | flag_alt = | image_shield = Brasao amapa.jpg | shield_alt = | nickname = | motto = | anthem = | image_map = Amapa in Brazil.svg | map_alt = | map_caption = Location of State of Amapá in Brazil | coordinates = | coordinates_footnotes = | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = | established_title = | established_date = | founder = | seat_type = Capital and largest city | seat = Macapá | government_footnotes = | leader_party = | leader_title = Governor | leader_name = Waldez Góes (PDT) | leader_title1 = Vice Governor | leader_name1 = Papaléo Paes (PP) | leader_title2 = Senators | leader_name2 = João Capiberibe (PSB) Davi Alcolumbre (DEM) Randolfe Rodrigues (REDE) | unit_pref = Metric | area_footnotes = | area_total_km2 = 142814.585 | area_rank = 18th | elevation_footnotes = | elevation_m = | population_footnotes = | population_total = 750,912 | population_as_of = 2014 | population_est = | pop_est_as_of = | population_rank = 26th | population_density_km2 = auto | population_density_rank = 23rd | population_demonym = Amapaense | population_note = | demographics_type1 = GDP | demographics1_footnotes = | demographics1_title1 = Year | demographics1_info1 = 2012 | demographics1_title2 = Total | demographics1_info2 = R$ 10,420,000,000 (25th) | demographics1_title3 = Per capita | demographics1_info3 = R$ 14,915.00 (15th) | demographics_type2 = HDI | demographics2_footnotes = | demographics2_title1 = Year | demographics2_info1 = 2014 | demographics2_title2 = Category | demographics2_info2 = 0.747 - high (12th) | timezone1 = BRT | utc_offset1 = -3 | timezone1_DST = | utc_offset1_DST = | iso_code = BR-AP | postal_code_type = Postal Code | postal_code = 68900-000 to 68999-000 | website = ap.gov.br | footnotes = }} Amapá is one of the states of Brazil. It is in the far north, bordering French Guiana in the north. To the east is the Atlantic Ocean, and to the south and west is the Brazilian state Pará. The state is mostly covered by rainforest. The state is known for producing iron and other metals. Amapá has only been a Brazilian state since 1988. ==References== Category:1988 establishments in Brazil
title: Amapá
